t: John 9
Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
As*p he went along, he saw a man blind from birth.
His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
“Neither*rp this*r man*r nor*r his*r parents*r sinned,”*r said Jesus, “but*r this*r happened*r so*r that*r the*r works*r of*r God*r might*r be*r displayed*r in*r him.*r
As*r long*r as*r it*r is*r day,*r we*r must*r do*r the*r works*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r Night*r is*r coming,*r when*r no*r one*r can*r work.*r
While*r I*r am*r in*r the*r world,*r I*r am*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world.”*r
After*p saying this, he spit on the ground, made some mud with the saliva, and put it on the man’s eyes.
“Go,”*r he told him, “wash*r in*r the*r Pool*r of*r Siloam”*r (this word means “Sent”). So the man went and washed, and came home seeing.
His*p neighbors and those who had formerly seen him begging asked, “Isn’t this the same man who used to sit and beg?”
Some claimed that he was. Others*p said, “No, he only looks like him.” But*p he himself insisted, “I am the man.”
“How*p then were your eyes opened?” they asked.
He*p replied, “The man they call Jesus made some mud and put it on my eyes. He told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see.”
“Where*p is this man?” they asked him. “I*p don’t know,” he said.
The Pharisees Investigate the Healing
They*p brought to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.
Now the day on which Jesus had made the mud and opened the man’s eyes was a Sabbath.
Therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. “He put mud on my eyes,” the man replied, “and I washed, and now I see.”
Some*p of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath.” But*p others asked, “How can a sinner perform such signs?” So they were divided.
Then*p they turned again to the blind man, “What have you to say about him? It was your eyes he opened.” The*p man replied, “He is a prophet.”
They*p still did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they sent for the man’s parents.
“Is this your son?” they asked. “Is this the one you say was born blind? How is it that now he can see?”
“We*p know he is our son,” the parents answered, “and we know he was born blind.
But how he can see now, or who opened his eyes, we don’t know. Ask him. He is of age; he will speak for himself.”
His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, who already had decided that anyone who acknowledged that Jesus was the Messiah would be put out of the synagogue.
That was why his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
A*p second time they summoned the man who had been blind. “Give glory to God by telling the truth,” they said. “We know this man is a sinner.”
He*p replied, “Whether he is a sinner or not, I don’t know. One thing I do know. I was blind but now I see!”
Then*p they asked him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
He*p answered, “I have told you already and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his disciples too?”
Then*p they hurled insults at him and said, “You are this fellow’s disciple! We are disciples of Moses!
We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this fellow, we don’t even know where he comes from.”
The*p man answered, “Now that is remarkable! You don’t know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.
We know that God does not listen to sinners. He listens to the godly person who does his will.
Nobody has ever heard of opening the eyes of a man born blind.
If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
To*p this they replied, “You were steeped in sin at birth; how dare you lecture us!” And they threw him out.
Spiritual Blindness
Jesus*p heard that they had thrown him out, and when he found him, he said, “Do*r you*r believe*r in*r the*r Son*r of*r Man?”*r
“Who*p is he, sir?” the man asked. “Tell me so that I may believe in him.”
Jesus*p said, “You*r have*r now*r seen*r him;*r in*r fact,*r he*r is*r the*r one*r speaking*r with*r you.”*r
Then*p the man said, “Lord, I believe,” and he worshiped him.
Jesus*p said, “For*r judgment*r I*r have*r come*r into*r this*r world,*r so*r that*r the*r blind*r will*r see*r and*r those*r who*r see*r will*r become*r blind.”*r
Some*p Pharisees who were with him heard him say this and asked, “What? Are we blind too?”
Jesus*p said, “If*r you*r were*r blind,*r you*r would*r not*r be*r guilty*r of*r sin;*r but*r now*r that*r you*r claim*r you*r can*r see,*r your*r guilt*r remains.*r
